title: Australia vs Pakistan, 3rd Test at Sydney: Steven Smith completes 50 Tests
text:
› Series › Australia vs Pakistan 2016-17 › News Australia vs Pakistan, 3rd Test at Sydney: Steven Smith completes 50 Tests Having made his Test debut as a leg-spinner in 2010, Steven Smith has raised to fame with consistency with his bat becoming the No. 1 batsman in the Whites. | Published : January 3, 2017 5:30 AM IST Steven Smith is currently the No. 1 batsman in Test 
Steven Smith , the Australian captain will play 50th test of his career when he and his team will play against Pakistan in the third Test at the Sydney Cricket Ground. Smith who made his Test debut against Pakistan six years ago at Lords back in July 2010 has amassed 4669 runs with an impressive average of 60.63. He has scored 17 Test centuries and holds the highest score of 215 which he scored opposite England at Lords. Smith took over the Tests captaincy from Michael Clarke in 2014 and has played 19 Tests as the Australian Tests skipper. As captain Smith has scored 2129 runs at an average of 76.03 with 9 centuries with a top score of 192. 
Smith also has 17 Tests wickets against his name with career-best bowling figures of 3 for 18. Having been so consistent with the bat, ironically Smith was first selected in the Australia squad as a leg-spinner for his debut and came in to bat at No. 8. He has also played 90 One-Day Internationals (ODIs) scoring 2880 runs at an average of 42.98 and 30 Twenty20 International (T20Is) scoring 431 runs with an average of 21.55. 
Full Cricket Scorecard: Pakistan vs Australia 3rd Test at Sydney 
The third Test, Australia will be playing as the winning side as they have already won the previous two Tests i.e the first Test at Brisbane by 39 runs and the second at Melbourne by an innings and 18 runs. Australia will be looking for winning the Sydney Test and registering a comprehensive whitewash over Pakistan which should act as a confidence booster for Australia in the new year. Pakistan on the other end would be looking to win the final Test and gain some pride after already getting whitewashed at the hands of New Zealand in a two-match Tests series.
